Falters at times: The claim falters at times because it incorrectly states that there are 82 counties in Ohio instead of the actual number, which is 88.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support because it does not provide any evidence or data to back up the statement that 80 out of 82 counties in Ohio have an auto manufacturing facility.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that if Mitt Romney had his way, all auto manufacturing facilities in Ohio would have gone out of business. This assumption is not supported by any evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the claim, such as the possibility that the statistic of 80 out of 82 counties having auto manufacturing facilities is outdated or inaccurate.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there are actually 88 counties in Ohio, not 82.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent of auto manufacturing facilities in Ohio by stating that almost all counties have them, without providing sufficient evidence to support this.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the claim.
